question: <katex>$\vec{E}$</katex> is the electric field inside a conductor whose material has conductivity <katex>$\sigma$</katex> and resistivity <katex>$\rho$</katex>. The current density inside the conductor is <katex>$\vec{j}$</katex>. The correct form of Ohm's law is
explanation: Microscopic form of Ohm's Law: <katex>$\vec{J} = \sigma \vec{E}$</katex> or <katex>$\vec{E} = \rho \vec{J}$</katex>.
